alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 3:04AM PST until January 17 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 7 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph will lead to blowing snow, causing reduced visibility. * WHERE...The Cascade mountains from highway 140 north. This includes, areas around Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, Crater Lake, and Lake of the Woods. Snow is expected across portions of highways 140, 62, 230, 58 and 138. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
